      • all

        public static <T> int all(T[] array,
                          T... elements)
        Check whether the given array contains all of the given elements.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the elements of the given array
        Parameters:
        array - the array to be checked
        elements - to check for
        Returns:
        the index of the elements missing on the given elements, Or -1 if no element missing
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if ether the given 'array' or 'elements' are null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if ether the given 'array' or 'elements' aren't an array

      • copyOf

        public static <T> T[] copyOf(T[] array,
                             int length)
        Get a copy of the given array. Copy to a new array from the given class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the elements of the given array
        Parameters:
        array - the array to be copied
        length - the length of the new
        Returns:
        a copy of the given array with the type of the given class
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given array is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given array isn't an array. Or the given class isn't an array class. Or the given length is negative

      • copyOf

        public static <T extends U,U> U[] copyOf(T[] array,
                                         int length,
                                         java.lang.Class<U[]> klass)
        Get a copy of the given array. Copy to a new array from the given class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the elements of the given array
        U - the type of the elements in the returned array
        Parameters:
        array - the array to be copied
        length - the length of the new
        klass - the type of the result array
        Returns:
        a copy of the given array with the type of the given class
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given array is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given array isn't an array. Or the given class isn't an array class. Or the given length is negative

      • copyOfRange

        public static <T> T[] copyOfRange(T[] array,
                                  int beginIndex,
                                  int endIndex)
        Copies the specified range of the specified array into a new array.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the elements on the given array
        Parameters:
        array - to get a subarray of
        beginIndex - the index to begin
        endIndex - the index to stop
        Returns:
        a subarray of the given array
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given 'array' is null
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if ether the beginIndex or the endIndex is negative. Or if the endIndex is less than beginIndex. Or if ether the beginIndex or the endIndex is greater than array.length.
        See Also:
        String.substring(int)

      • hardcopy

        public static void hardcopy(java.lang.Object src,
                            int srcPos,
                            java.lang.Object dest,
                            int destPos,
                            int length)
        Copies elements on an array from the specified source array, beginning at the specified position, to the specified position of the destination array. A subsequence of array components are copied from the source array referenced by src to the destination array referenced by dest. The number of components copied is equal to the length argument. The components at positions srcPos through srcPos+length-1 in the source array are copied into positions destPos through destPos+length-1, respectively, of the destination array.If the src and dest arguments refer to the same array object, then the copying is performed as if the components at positions srcPos through srcPos+length-1 were first copied to a temporary array with length components and then the contents of the temporary array were copied into positions destPos through destPos+length-1 of the destination array. If dest is null, then a NullPointerException is thrown. If src is null, then a NullPointerException is thrown and the destination array is not modified. Otherwise, if any of the following is true, an ArrayStoreException is thrown and the destination is not modified:
        • The src argument refers to an object that is not an array.
        • The dest argument refers to an object that is not an array.
        Otherwise, if any of the following is true, an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown and the destination is not modified:
        • The srcPos argument is negative.
        • The destPos argument is negative.
        • The length argument is negative.
        • srcPos+length is greater than src.length, the length of the source array.
        • destPos+length is greater than dest.length, the length of the destination array.
        Otherwise, if any actual component of the source array from position srcPos through srcPos+length-1 cannot be converted to the component type of the destination array by assignment conversion, an ArrayStoreException is thrown. In this case, let k be the smallest nonnegative integer less than length such that src[srcPos+k] cannot be converted to the component type of the destination array; when the exception is thrown, source array components from positions srcPos through srcPos+k-1 will already have been copied to destination array positions destPos through destPos+k-1 and no other positions of the destination array will have been modified. (Because of the restrictions already itemized, this paragraph effectively applies only to the situation where both arrays have component types that are reference types.)

        Note: the different between this method and System.arraycopy(Object, int, Object, int, int) is how it deals with primitive array. As this method don't mind if ether the src or dest have primitive or objective types. It copies anyway.

        Parameters:
        src - the source array.
        srcPos - starting position in the source array.
        dest - the destination array.
        destPos - starting position in the destination data.
        length - the number of array elements to be copied.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if copying would cause access of data outside array bounds.
        java.lang.ArrayStoreException - if an element in the src array could not be stored into the dest array because of a type mismatch.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either src or dest is null.
        See Also:
        System.arraycopy(Object, int, Object, int, int)

      • merge

        public static <T> T[] merge(T[]... arrays)
        Merge the given arrays in a new array. The new array will contain the content of the given arrays merged in order.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the given arrays
        Parameters:
        arrays - the arrays to be merged
        Returns:
        an array that includes all the elements of the given arrays ordered with the order of the arrays given.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the given arrays is not actually an array. Or if the given class isn't an array class
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if 'arrays' param is null. Or if any of the given arrays are null. Or if the given klass is null
        java.lang.ArrayStoreException - if any element from the given arrays can't be stored at the product array

      • merge

                                        T[]... arrays)

      • sum

        public static <T,U> T sum(U[] array,
                          T sum,
                          java.util.function.BiFunction<T,U,T> function)
        Get the total sum of the given array. By applying the given function foreach element of the given array. Then sum all the returned values together.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the sum
        U - the type of the elements on the given array
        Parameters:
        array - to sum their elements
        sum - the initial sum
        function - the function to get the value of each element
        Returns:
        the total sum of the given arrays
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if ether the given 'array' or the given 'function' is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the given array isn't actually an array

      • sum

                        T sum,
                        java.util.function.BiFunction<T,java.lang.Boolean,T> function)

        Parameters:
        array - to sum their elements
        sum - the initial sum
        function - the function to get the value of each element
        Returns:
        the total sum of the given arrays
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if ether the given 'array' or the given 'function' is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the given array isn't actually an array

      • sum

                        T sum,
                        java.util.function.BiFunction<T,java.lang.Character,T> function)
        Get the total sum of the given array. By applying the given function foreach element of the given array. Then sum all the returned values together.
